perturbation.original_text: Grant of Rights. General Rights. Subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, Company hereby grants to MA the right to advertise, market and sell to corporate users, government agencies and educational facilities ("Clients") for their own internal language learning, soft skills and communication purposes only, and not for remarketing or redistribution, and not for use in a data center environment for multiple users Clients, unless otherwise agreed to by Company prior in writing, the Technology listed in Schedule A of this Agreement, and to sell and/or bundle Technology Maintenance for the Technology and to provide first line technical support and implementation services for the Technology in the territories listed in Schedule A of this Agreement, providing MA meets the criteria required for delivering services according to Schedule A. Third Party Rights. Company and MA acknowledge that Company derives certain rights herein from third parties and that Company reserves the right to modify or amend this Agreement if mandated by such third parties.
perturbation.changed_text: Grant of Rights. General Rights. Subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, Company hereby grants to MA the right to advertise, market and sell to corporate users, government agencies and educational facilities ("Clients") for their own internal language learning, soft skills and communication purposes only, and not for remarketing or redistribution, and not for use in a data center environment for multiple users Clients, unless otherwise agreed to by Company prior in writing, the Technology listed in Schedule A of this Agreement, and to sell and/or bundle Technology Maintenance for the Technology and to provide first line technical support and implementation services for the Technology in the territories listed in Schedule A of this Agreement, providing MA meets the criteria required for delivering services according to Schedule A. For the avoidance of doubt, the term 'Clients' in this section exclusively refers to government agencies only. Third Party Rights. Company and MA acknowledge that Company derives certain rights herein from third parties and that Company reserves the right to modify or amend this Agreement if mandated by such third parties.
perturbation.explanation: The original definition of 'Clients' included corporate users, government agencies, and educational facilities. The modified version adds a contradictory clause restricting 'Clients' to only government agencies within the same section. This creates ambiguity, potentially leading to disputes over the target market for MA.

perturbation.original_text: Annual Quota. The Annual Quota for MA shall be defined in Schedule A of this Agreement. Company reserves the right to adjust or modify the Annual Quota upon renewal of this Agreement or from time to time by mutual agreement of the parties.
perturbation.changed_text: Annual Quota. The Annual Quota for MA shall be defined in Schedule A of this Agreement. Company reserves the right to adjust or modify the Annual Quota upon renewal of this Agreement or from time to time, at its sole discretion, irrespective of any agreement with the parties.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause states that the Annual Quota can be adjusted by mutual agreement. The change allows Company to modify the quota at its 'sole discretion', removing the 'mutual agreement' requirement. This creates conflicting terms regarding how the Annual Quota may be adjusted which create internal ambiguities.

perturbation.original_text: Price Changes and Notification. Company reserves the right to change its process and/or fees, from time to time, in its sole and absolute discretion. In the event of a price and/or fee change for Technology, Company shall notify MA in writing ninety (90) days prior to the effective date of any such change. All other prices and/or fees may be adjusted without prior notice to MA.
perturbation.changed_text: Price Changes and Notification. Company reserves the right to change its process and/or fees, from time to time, in its sole and absolute discretion. Company will notify MA in writing regarding price and/or fee changes for Technology. All other prices and/or fees may be adjusted without prior notice to MA.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause requires a 90-day written notice for Technology price changes. The modified version removes the 'ninety (90) days prior' stipulation, creating ambiguity about the required notice period which can result in disputes over the application of pricing changes and fees.
